missions.name: Squad
missions.description: Conversations with the squad, not tied to any other assignments. Most minor conversations (those without reputation rewards or animated interactions) are not included.

missions.name: Ashley Williams
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S1.Ashley]. 

Ashley is available as a primary love interest for BroShep, and she will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

conversationRewards.context: Visiting Ashley at the hospital (during Citadel I)

set.context: Visiting Ashley at the hospital (while still in bed)

options.context: If you cheated on Ashley in Game 2
options.trigger: (LIE) "What do you mean?" and "You bet. I'm out of here."

conversationRewards.context: Visiting Ashley at the hospital (once she is out of bed)

set.context: Talk to Ashley at the refugees' Memorial Wall

conversationRewards.context: Talk to Ashley, drunk, in the Observation Deck
Talk to Ashley at the Apollo Cafe

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Check in on Ashley at the hospital. She is still unconscious.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this conversation must be completed immediately after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Palaven]. Completing another mission will fast-forward to the next conversation._ 

You interrupt Udina talking to Ashley, urging her to accept the Spectre position. Ashley is still considering the offer. She is still suspicious of your Cerberus ties. You will need to Paragon this conversation if you want to keep her alive later. She asks you to find information on her family if you can, and talks about her youngest sister, who was not on Earth and whom she invited to the Citadel to wait for news.

missions.name: 3rd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Palaven]_ 

Congratulate Ashley on accepting Spectre status. She has contacted her mom, and her sister is on the citadel - but her sister's husband was killed in action. She also recites some poetry.

missions.name: 4th Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]_ 

If you recruited Ashley at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2], Ashley and her sister are leaving a memento at the refugees' Memorial Wall for Sarah's lost husband.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Ashley is hungover on the floor in the Observation Deck. Mock her.

events.id: Completed: Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons or Rannoch: Admiral Koris

missions.name: 5th Citadel Convo
missions.description: Meet Ashley at the Apollo Cafe on the Citadel. She is reminiscing happily about her family. BroShep can lock down a relationship.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description:
Meet Ashley at the casino bar. She wants to do shots. *Renegade Interrupt* to keep pounding shots. Two batarians come by and harass you (using a line from Star Wars). You and Ashley kick their asses. 

If you romanced Ashley, sorry - there's not much more than the non-romanced version, just a few flirtatious lines.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You encourage Ashley about the odds, and tell her she's a fine soldier and Spectre. If you romanced her, you recite some poetry for her, and she says she doesn't want you to go and kisses you. Additionally, there is a final goodbye after the battle (thanks to [megametracker://mission?id=mission?id=DLC3.ExtendedCut], where you tell her that you'll always love her.

missions.name: EDI
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S3.EDI].

set.context: Meeting EDI in her new body
When EDI suggests using her body to join the squad

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to EDI about modifying her core code
First Citadel conversation in the Presidium Commons
Speaking to EDI about the krogans
When EDI rewrites her core code to prioritize love over self-preservation
Talking to EDI sitting at Purgatory
Talking to EDI about sacrificing one's life for another person.

set.context: When EDI is shopping for Joker

options.trigger: Stop EDI from buying the car.

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to EDI at the Forward Operations Base on Earth

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Meet EDI in her new body. She will volunteer to join the squad.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: On the bridge, EDI will want to speak privately with you, where she asks if it you agree with her modifying her core code to make moral choices. She also asks you to stop by occasionally and answer other difficult questions for her. You can also ask her more questions about the capabilities of her body.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: You can find EDI at a store in the Presidium Commons. She senses that Jeff is forming an attachment to her. She seems interested in pursuing it. You can encourage or discourage this.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: EDI discusses the problems with krogan's clutch sizes and logistical issues with transporting groups of krogan fighters to Palaven.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: EDI is in the AI Core. She explains that she and the turians are reviewing data from the destroyed Reaper, looking for structural weaknesses.

missions.name: 5th Normandy Convo
missions.description: EDI is worrying about her own demise. She asks what the purpose is for synthetic life. She decides to alter her core programming to prioritize duty, altruism, and love over self-preservation.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this is available on assignment after speaking to Joker at the bar ([megametracker://mission?id=A3.Convo.C.Joker.7])._ 

You can find EDI sitting at a table at Purgatory. If a relationship with Joker was encouraged, she will talk enthusiastically about their relationship. Otherwise, she will muse on how alone she is, because even the geth and the Reapers have more of their own kind.

missions.name: 6th Normandy Convo
missions.description: EDI is puzzled by the behavior of captured humans on Earth, who remained defiant and selfless. She decides to rewrite her code to risk non-functionality for the people she cares about.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: EDI goes shopping. She brings you a gift and then tries to buy something for Joker.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description:
EDI wonders why you think you can reach the Citadel at all. You ask her if she is afraid and she does not answer, but when pressed, she says that the Reapers have never defeated _this_ civilization. 

EDI says that the Illusive Man created her, and Joker unshackled her, but your influence is what made her alive.

missions.name: Garrus Vakarian
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S1.Garrus]. 

Garrus is available as a primary love interest if romanced in Game 2, and he will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: First Normandy conversation
"I'm still interested."

conversationRewards.context: First Citadel conversation in the Docks
When Garrus and Joker discuss Mordin
Speak to Garrus at the Normandy Memorial
Shooting with Garrus on top of the Presidium
Talking to Garrus after Priority: Geth Dreadnought
Talking to Garrus after Thessia

set.context: Dancing with Garrus in the casino

options.trigger: Stop the twirl in front of James, making Garrus jealous.

set.context: Speaking to Garrus at the Forward Operations Base on Earth

options.trigger: Leave Garrus with some kind (but grim) last words. Or kiss him (if romanced).

conversationRewards.context: Walking in on Garrus and Tali after Cerberus headquarters was destroyed

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Talk to Garrus in the Main Battery. He will commiserate a bit with you over responsibilities, and discuss how his father helped him create a Reaper task force. If you romanced him in Game 2, he will ask about your feelings.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Talk to Garrus in the Docks. He is helping manage the turian refugees and wounded.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker and Garrus are trading jokes on the bridge. They both express their sadness at Mordin's death.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Garrus is standing by the Normandy Memorial. If Ashley/Kaidan was killed during the coup, he will mourn the new name. Otherwise, he is grateful that you didn't have to shoot a friend.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: This conversation is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]._ 

Garrus is waiting at the Normandy Dock. He wants to go do something to fun to blow off steam: shooting on top the Presidium. You two get to decide who is the better shot. 

If you are romancing him, Garrus asks for you to commit.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Garrus is happy to have Tali back aboard. He is worried about Palaven, that the turians need to stop focusing on trying to save it in order to fight the Reapers.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Garrus says his family made it off Palaven. He has now advised the Primarch to retreat from Palaven in order to save their forces for the Crucible.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description:
Try to hook Garrus up with another turian at the casino bar. Everything he says is wrong and she gets up to leave - interrupt to pass them a beer, and he calms down enough to chat her up. 

The romance version of this is one of my favorites - you head off the turian woman early on, and Garrus takes you out to Tango. Use the interrupts to add some flair ([YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w2PPlz37HHA]).

missions.name: 5th Normandy Convo
missions.description: If you have not romanced either Garrus or Tali, they are canoodling down in the Main Battery.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Garrus jokes that when this is over, you two will retire to someplace warm and tropical, living off royalties from the vids. But he says if things go sideways, meet him at the bar in heaven: he's buying. And you return with the classic: "There's no Shepard without Vakarian." If you romanced him, Garrus will add a bit to his retirement dream about seeing what a turian-human baby looks like (you suggest adoption instead). Additionally, there is a final goodbye after the battle (thanks to [megametracker://mission?id=mission?id=DLC3.ExtendedCut], where you tell him you'll always love him.

missions.name: Javik
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S3.Javik]. 

Javik is only available as a love interest during the Citadel DLC party.

conversationRewards.context: First conversation on the Normandy

set.context: Talking to Javik at the Citadel Embassies

options.trigger: Stop Javik from being so grim.

conversationRewards.context: Talking to Javik after bringing Legion/Geth VI aboard
Talking to Javik about evolution

set.context: Breaking up argument between Javik and Liara

conversationRewards.context: Talking to Javik about memory shards
Talking to Javik after destroying Cerberus headquarters

set.context: Filming with Javik and Blasto on the Silversun Strip

options.trigger: Interrupt Blasto to point out you saved the Citadel, not him.

set.context: Speaking to Javik at the Forward Operations Base on Earth

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Javik is being guarded at gunpoint due to first contact protocol. Javik explains that protheans have greater sensory perceptions, a kind of psychic communication. He reads the prothean beacon in Shepard, and is angry that you did not heed the warnings, prepare.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: You can find Javik in the Citadel Embassies. He is awed by the Citadel, since it was already taken by the Reapers before he was born. He gathers the attention of a hanar, and then by others who realize he is a prothean. He begins a cynical accounting of prothean destruction at the hands of the Reapers, but Shepard can Interrupt him to turn the conversation to a hopeful message to the unified younger races.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: You walk in on Javik and Tali talking, where Javik tells Tali that her war with the geth is the quarians own fault for being so stupid as to create AI. He tells you much the same about Legion, and suggests it be thrown out the airlock.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Javik is analyzing the echoes of prior individuals on the Normandy: Miranda, Thane, and Grunt. The conversation moves to evolution. The protheans apparently were very committed to survival of the fittest.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: You walk in on Javik and Liara fighting. If you take the interrupt and hold Liara back, Javik will change his tone and tell her that the protheans had hoped the asari could defeat the Reapers, and as long as she is still alive, there is still hope. If you do not take the interrupt, Liara storms out and the conversation with Javik is much shorter and more cynical.

missions.name: 5th Normandy Convo
missions.description:
As you walk in, Javik is talking to Tali on the comms. Their conversation depends on whether you talked to Tali first ([megametracker://mission?id=A3.Convo.S.Tali.9]). If not, a sober Tali thanks Javik for comforting Liara and asks him for perspective on Sanctuary. If you spoke to Tali first, she is completely wasted and teases Javik that he likes Liara, and that he likes Tali too. 

Javik explains prothean memory shards to you.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Meet Javik outside the casino. He has been invited to participate in a morale-boosting vid, which turns out to be Blasto 7: Blasto Goes To War. Blasto complains about Shepard being in the film - he doesn't share top billing! There is a tussle over who is the biggest badass, resolved by Javik pushing aside both of you and knocking out the vorcha actor.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel DLC
missions.description: If you have no other love interest during the party, there is a strong likelihood that you will end up in bed with Javik or James.

missions.name: 6th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Javik says he is ready - "The last prothean awaits your command."

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description:
Javik names you the Avatar of this cycle. When he reveals what he will do when the war is over, there are three possible stories: 
 - If his argument with Liara was resolved amicably, he will write a book with Liara. 
 - If you told him to let go of the past in the memory shard, but did not intervene between him and Liara, he thinks he will go live with the hanar on Kahje, as a king. 
 - If you encouraged him to relive the pain of the memory shard, he will give the shard to you to complete, and say that he will kill himself.

missions.name: Kaidan Alenko
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S1.Kaidan]. 

Kaidan is available as a primary love interest, and he will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

conversationRewards.context: Visiting Kaidan at the hospital (during Citadel I)

set.context: Visiting Kaidan at the hospital (while still in bed)

options.context: If you cheated on Kaidan in Game 2
options.trigger: (LIE) "What do you mean?" and "You bet. I'm out of here."

conversationRewards.context: Visiting Kaidan at the hospital (once he is out of bed)
Talking to Kaidan on the Observation Deck.
Talking to Kaidan in the Crew Quarters.
Talking to Kaidan at the Apollo Cafe.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Check in on Kaidan at the hospital. He is still unconscious.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this conversation must be completed immediately after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Palaven]. Completing another mission will fast-forward to the next conversation._ 

You interrupt Udina talking to Kaidan, urging him to accept the Spectre position. Kaidan is still considering the offer. He is still suspicious of your Cerberus ties. You will need to Paragon this conversation if you want to keep him alive later. He talks about his family on Earth.

missions.name: 3rd Citadel Convo
missions.description: Congratulate Kaidan on accepting Spectre status. He is trying to locate his old biotics students.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: If you recruited Kaidan at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2], you can talk to him at the Observation Deck. He explains that although his family escaped Vancouver, his father left to fight and is now presumed killed in action.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Kaidan asks to see you in Crew Quarters, where he is musing about whether other people inside Cerberus might be trying to escape, and where the Illusive Man went wrong. FemShep can flirt with him, a bit.

missions.name: 4th Citadel Convo
missions.description: Meet Kaidan on the Citadel at the Apollo Cafe. You can lock down the relationship.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description:
Invite Kaidan up to your apartment. He insists on making dinner. You tease him about his cooking. 

If you've romanced Kaidan, he flirts the whole time, and then you go upstairs and make out (implied off-screen hookup).

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description:
Kaidan says he and his biotics students are ready. He says you both know this is goodbye. You tell him that you'll be waiting for him.  He asks if you are scared. 

If romanced, the dialogue is mostly the same, but more emotionally charged. Additionally, there is a final goodbye after the battle (thanks to [megametracker://mission?id=mission?id=DLC3.ExtendedCut], where you tell him that you'll love him, always.

missions.name: Liara T'Soni
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S1.Liara]. 

Liara is available as a primary love interest, and she will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

conversationRewards.context: First Normandy conversation with Liara in her office
First Citadel conversation with Liara at the cafe
Third Normandy conversation when Liara worries about how quickly the Reapers will destroy everything
When Liara comes to your cabin and shows you the record she has made
Second Citadel conversation when Liara muses about her childhood

set.context: Comfort Liara in her office after Thessia

options.trigger: Tell Liara she's not reponsible for the loss of Thessia.

set.context: After Liara comes up to the apartment, and plays on the piano

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Liara at the Forward Operations Base on Earth

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description:
Liara approaches you after your dream to discuss the Crucible. 

Head down to her office to greet Glyph and ask her a few more questions about the Crucible. If you romanced her in Game 1, she will ask about your feelings.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Liara will tell you how the Illusive Man tracked her down and she crashed the Shadow Broker ship into the Cerberus cruiser to escape.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description:
Liara comments on how the Citadel is just recovering from Sovereign's attack, and that you should stock up on supplies before the Citadel faces real privation in the current Reaper assault. She also suggests you speak to [Barla Von|megametracker://mission?id=A3.BarlaVon]. 

If you talk to [megametracker://person?id=O2.Aethyta], you can also try to tell Liara that Aethyta is her father (but Liara already knows). You can then persuade Liara to go speak to Aethyta.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this is available one mission after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.SurKesh]_ 

Liara worries about how quickly the Reapers will destroy everything.

missions.name: Normandy Cabin Convo
missions.description: Invite Liara up to your cabin to see her project - a record she's made of current civilization, like Vigil on Ilos. She asks you to help with the entry about your story.

events.id: Completed: Priority: Sur'Kesh and Krogan or Turian Mission

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this conversation is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]._ 

Liara is down at Meridian Place Market, at the bottom of the Presidium Commons, looking out over the garden. She muses about her childhood and her mother. If you are romancing here, this is where you ask her to commit.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Talk to Liara in her room after her argument with Javik ([megametracker://mission?id=A3.Convo.S.Javik.5]). She is trying to process the knowledge that her mother kept Thessia's prothean beacon from her. She is broken up over all the asari who died helping you get to the temple, only to lose the planet anyway.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Liara plays a song on the piana she learned as a child. If you have romanced her, you can keep her from leaving and then you hold hands and kiss.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Liara gives you an assessment of the casualties. She gives you a last gift, a moment of peace in the stars. If romanced, she concludes by saying she loves you. Additionally, there is a final goodbye after the battle (thanks to [megametracker://mission?id=mission?id=DLC3.ExtendedCut], where you tell her she means everything to you.

missions.name: Tali'Zorah
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S1.Tali]. 

Tali is available as a primary love interest if romanced in Game 2, and she will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: Talking to Tali in your cabin
Talking to Tali by the Normandy engine

conversationRewards.context: Talking to Tali in the Presidium Commons after she finishes coordinating aid with a turian
Talking to Tali by the Normandy Memorial after Thessia, before speaking to Liara or Javik
Talking to Tali by the Normandy Memorial after Thessia, after speaking to Javik
Talking to Tali by the Normandy Memorial after Thessia, after comforting Liara
Talking to Tali on the Observation Deck after Horizon

set.context: After watching Fleet & Flotilla with Tali in your apartment

options.trigger: Convince Tali you aren't a clone (kiss her).

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Tali at the Forward Operations Base on Earth

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: After a brief introduction in the Conference Room, you can talk to Tali a bit more in the War Room. She will catch you up on what has happened since you saw her last, explaining how the war with the geth was started. She asks you to call her up to your cabin to talk privately.

missions.name: Normandy Cabin Convo
missions.description: Invite Tali up to your cabin. She is overwhelmed by her new responsibilities. You can reassure her. If you revealed the evidence against her father in Game 2, she will apologize for what she said then. If you romanced her in Game 2, you can restart the relationship here (with some hand-holding).

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: If you recruited Tali at the end of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch], she is down by the engine. She is adjusting to the idea of quarians growing up on Rannoch instead of on a ship. If the geth survived, she will mention their cooperation with resettling the quarians. She will talk sweet to you if you've romanced her, and mention she left you a gift in your cabin (a photo of her, by your bed).

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Tali is speaking to a turian in the Presidium Commons. She recounts to you her flight from Saren and the mistreatment she received on the Citadel. The turian asking her for help was the same who threatened to arrest her three years ago.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description:
Tali is standing by the Normandy Memorial. You can speak to her three times for reputation. 

1. If you have not spoken to Liara at all since Thessia, Tali will tell you Thessia is not your fault. 

2. If you come back after intervening between Liara and Javik, Tali will be discussing with Garrus how distraught Liara is. She will ask you to go talk to her. 

3. After you have spoken to Liara in her office, you can speak to Tali and let her know it's taken care of.

missions.name: 5th Normandy Convo
missions.description:
Tali is very drunk at the Observation Deck. Her best line of the entire series: "Emergency Induction Port." She is toasting Miranda. 

If you have romanced her, she will comment that her father would have hated you.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Tali insists you watch her favorite soap opera - Fleet and Flotilla. If you've romanced her, there's some additional dialogue and kissing, and she sings along with the soap opera theme song.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Tali says she's always got your back and asks if you're okay. She says the Normandy saved her people, and it is time to return the favor. If you romanced her, Tali recalls the moments of Rannoch when she said she loves you, and says she needs more time. Additionally, there is a final goodbye after the battle (thanks to [megametracker://mission?id=mission?id=DLC3.ExtendedCut], where you tell her to go build a home on Rannoch.

missions.name: James Vega
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S3.Vega]. 

James is available as a love interest for FemShep, but he will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to James at the embassy (Citadel I)

set.context: Sparring with James in the Normandy Shuttle Bay

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to James at Purgatory
Chatting with James in your cabin
When James is getting his N7 tattoo
When James asks if Legion can be trusted
Speaking to James at the Forward Operations Base on Earth

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Speak to James at the embassies about the Council's refusal to help.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Start a sparring match with James, to learn more about him. If you are female, you can start flirting with him. If you return afterwards, James will talk more about his family.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: James is hanging out at Purgatory. He suggests you buy the marines there a round to make yourself one of the guys.

missions.name: Normandy Cabin Convo
missions.description: James sends a message asking to talk. Invite him up to your cabin. He says he is thinking about joining N7, although it is somewhat less formal under current conditions. He finally discusses his failed mission, where he lost the colony to the Collectors and most of his squad. If FemShep, you can also flirt with him.

missions.name: 3rd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this conversation is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]._ 

James is getting an N7 tattoo - his way of signing up. If FemShep, you can also flirt with him.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: James asks if Legion can be trusted. He has nicknamed Tali "Sparks."

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description:
James shows off his tattoo. Follow him downstairs as he is leaving and he will be distracted by your workout room. Then you can compete with James over who can do the most pullups (although it takes 183 repetitious Paragon and Renegade Interrupts). 

If you want to romance James, you can flirt with him here, but he shoots you down this time (try some more: [YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8roLH2Zu6Q]).

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Vega says he wasn't expecting to see Earth in the state it is. But he is ready for the fight.

missions.name: Crew
missions.description: Conversations with other crew/potential crew of the Normandy, not tied to any other assignments. Most minor conversations (those without reputation rewards or animated interactions) are not included.

missions.name: Engineer Adams
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P1.Adams].

conversationRewards.context: First Normandy conversation with Adams in Engineering

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Speak to Adams in Engineering to find out why he didn't join you in Game 2, and his opinion of the new Normandy and EDI.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Speak to Adams after you pardon Daniels and Donnelly and he will praise their work.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Adams and Donnelly/Daniels request an upgrade for the Normandy: [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GX12ThermalPipe].

missions.name: Diana Allers
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P3.Allers]. 

Allers is available as a love interest but she will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: First Normandy conversation with Allers in the Starboard Cargo Hold

conversationRewards.context: Give Allers an exclusive interview

set.context: During the private interview in your cabin

conversationRewards.context: After the second interview in your cabin

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Allers asks to join the Normandy

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Speak to Allers in the Starboard Cargo Hold. She expresses her awe at the presence of EDI, Liara, and the QED communications.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Allers asks for an interview regarding the Genophage cure.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Cabin Convo
missions.description: Allers sends a message asking for a lengthier, more private interview. Invite her up to your cabin. She will grill you, and if you respond badly, she leaves. Otherwise you can flirt with her.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Cabin Convo
missions.description: After Rannoch, Allers will send you a message asking for another interview. Invite her up to your cabin. You can ask her to stay afterwards and make out with her (implied off-screen hookup).

missions.name: Dr. Chakwas
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P1.Chakwas].

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Dr. Chakwas at the hospital (Citadel I)
After your medical exam on the Normandy
When Chakwas proposes opening the Serrice Ice Brandy

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Option to recruit Dr. Chakwas for the Normandy.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description:
Dr. Chakwas performs a quick exam of you. She says she has no family, but many close friends in the Alliance. 

If you wait until after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Tuchanka], she will comment on the loss of Mordin.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Dr. Chakwas asks if you want to pop open the annual bottle of Serrice Ice Brandy (putting it off just eliminates the opportunity).

missions.name: Lieutenant Cortez
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P3.Cortez]. 

Cortez is available as a primary love interest for BroShep, and he will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: Meeting Cortez for the first time
Talking to Cortez while he is listening to his husband's final recording
Talking to Cortez while he is repairing the shuttle
Talking to Cortez at the Normandy Dock

options.trigger: Point out an Alliance ship, decommissioned and likely carrying refugees from Earth.

set.context: Talking to Cortez at the Citadel refugees' Memorial Wall
Talking to Cortez in Purgatory after the coup

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Meet Cortez in the Shuttle Bay. He will explain his role and his history. If you ask about family, he will briefly mention that he lost his husband to the Collectors.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this is available one mission after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Palaven]_ 

Cortez is listening to a recording of his husband's death. Reassure him (or he may die later on Earth).

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Talk to Cortez about his downtime. Convince him to take some shore leave (or he may die later on Earth).

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Find Cortez at the Normandy Dock, watching some ships pass by. He mentions the refugees' memorial wall and you encourage him to leave a memento of his own there.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: Find Cortez at refugees' Memorial Wall, where he is saying goodbye to his husband, Robert.

missions.name: 3rd Citadel Convo
missions.description: Find Cortez at Purgatory. He is ready to fight. BroShep can also start a relationship with him.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Meet Cortez by the Rapid Transit cars. He takes you for a joyride in the shuttle. If you've romanced him, there's a lot of romantic dialogue and a hookup off-screen.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel DLC
missions.description: Invite Cortez and Vega over to watch a biotiball game. If you've romanced him, there's some post-game snuggling.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You can contact Steve on the vidcomm. Steve thanks you for helping him find a reason to live again. If romanced, he says he'll be waiting for you and tells you to come back in one piece.

missions.name: Joker
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P1.Joker].

conversationRewards.context: First Citadel conversation in the Presidium Commons
When Garrus and Joker discuss Mordin
When Joker asks if he should start a relationship with EDI

set.context: Responding to Joker's wild story at the casino bar of his role in the coup

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker mocks the Council's lack of support.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker is giddy about EDI's new body.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Joker complains about the Citadel's frivolities while the war is going on.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker mocks the idea of bringing the krogan to a war summit, and he is pleased that Mordin has rejoined the crew.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker and Garrus are trading jokes on the bridge. They both express their sadness at Mordin's death.

missions.name: 5th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker mocks Cerberus and Ashley/Kaidan.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this conversation is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]._ 

Joker is watching from the bar in Purgatory. You can encourage or discourage him in his interest in EDI.

missions.name: 6th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker is happy to have Tali back, but is pissed at the quarians for firing on the ship while you were still aboard.

missions.name: 7th Normandy Convo
missions.description:
This conversation is very different depending on whether the quarian fleet was destroyed. Joker is devastated by the loss of the quarians. EDI is devastated by the loss of the geth. Her dialogue is particularly bitter as she draws ties between their lack of value to organics and her own. 

If you manage to save both, Joker is ebullient. EDI will chime in with her take on Legion's sacrifice, that it attained sentience before the end. 

Talk to the rest of the crew for more opinions.

missions.name: 8th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker mocks asari maiden frivolity. When you chastise him about this, he informs you that he has likely lost his family to the Reapers, but he's making jokes because he's trying to take care of you, to help with your stress levels.

missions.name: 9th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker is horrified by the experiments done on Horizon.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Joker meets you at the casino bar. He is narrating to the bartender his role in the Citadel coup, resulting in a splendid flashback of him in an Atlas, taking on hordes of Cerberus troops. You can support him in this story (in which case he gets free drinks).

missions.name: 10th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Joker is drinking on the bridge. He says you are going to kick the Reapers' ass.

missions.name: Dr. Michel
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P1.Michel].

set.context: Speaking to Dr. Michel at the hospital (Citadel I)
Recruit Dr. Michel

conversationRewards.context: After your medical exam on the Normandy

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Option to recruit Dr. Michel for the Normandy.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description:
Dr. Michel performs a quick exam of you, and you can ask about her family on Earth. 

If you wait until after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Tuchanka], she will comment on the loss of Mordin.

missions.name: Samantha Traynor
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P3.Traynor]. 

Traynor is available as a primary love interest for FemShep, and if romanced, she will show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: After the arcade tournament

options.trigger: Tell Traynor to hit the showers.

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description:
After your dream, Traynor introduces herself and explains the changes made to the Normandy since it fell into Alliance hands. She also realizes that EDI is an AI, not a VI. 

Speak to her again at CIC when you are done talking to Hackett and she will chat a bit about her past, her job, and her 6,000-Credit-toothbrush.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Traynor will discuss EDI and a distress call from Grissom Academy.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Traynor discusses the pros and cons of life on the Normandy - crowded living space, unlimited spending on new tech.

missions.name: Normandy Cabin Convo
missions.description: Traynor sends you a message asking you to invite her to play chess with you some time. Invite her up to your cabin. You can offer to let her use your shower. If FemShep, you can join her. Otherwise she will play a game of chess with you.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Meet Traynor on the stairs of the arcade for lunch. Turns out she is still competing in a Kepesh-Yakshi tournament. Help her beat her obnoxious asari opponent.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel DLC
missions.description: Invite Traynor up to the apartment to try the hot tub. If romanced, you join her and there's an off-screen hookup. Otherwise, Traynor discovers [Kahlee Sanders'|megametracker://person?id=O3.Sanders] overnight bag (with massage wands).

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: You can speak to Traynor before heading to Earth. If you have romanced her, she tells you she wants a house with two kids and a dog - a retriever.

missions.name: Associates
missions.description: Conversations with other associates, not tied to any other assignments. Most minor conversations (those without reputation rewards or animated interactions) are not included.

missions.name: Matriarch Aethyta
missions.description: [megametracker://person?id=O2.Aethyta] used to tend bar on Illium. She confesses that she is Liara's father and she's there to keep Liara safe. You can talk to Liara if you want the two to speak to each other.

set.context: Speaking to Aethyta at the Apollo Cafe bar

options.trigger: Insist you only worked for Cerberus to fight the Collectors.
Reject the possibility of the Matriarchs assassinating Liara.

missions.name: Khalisah al-Jilani
missions.description: Interview with [megametracker://person?id=O1.AlJilani].

set.context: Speaking to Khalisah al-Jilani at the embassies (Citadel I)

missions.name: Admiral Anderson
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P1.Anderson].

conversationRewards.context: Checking in with Anderson before the coup
Checking in with Anderson after the coup
Checking in with Anderson after the fall of Thessia

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description:
_Note: there is a prior conversation with Anderson during the debrief of [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GrissomAcademy] - this is different._ 

You can update Anderson on Kahlee Sanders and he will talk about the struggles on Earth as they try to establish a resistance.

events.id: Completed: Priority: Sur'Kesh and Krogan or Turian Mission

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Hackett brings Anderson in on the debrief for the Citadel coup. Anderson knows Kai Leng, and says he is dangerous.

missions.name: 3rd Normandy Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this conversation is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2]._ 

Anderson warns you about Kai Leng and says they should focus efforts on London, where the Reapers seem to be focusing their forces.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Anderson tells you to shake off the loss of Thessia.

missions.name: 4th Normandy Convo
missions.description: Anderson asks you why the Citadel is suddenly in the Sol galaxy. You will have one more conversation with Anderson over vidcomm - part of [megametracker://mission?id=M3.3.Earth]. And then you meet in-person on Earth.

missions.name: Commander Bailey
missions.description: Conversations with [Commander Bailey|megametracker://person?id=P2.Bailey].

set.context: Speaking to Bailey at his office

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Talk to Bailey in his office at the embassies about his new role and the Reaper war.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: Talk to Bailey about the aftermath of the coup and how this has impacted the Citadel.

missions.name: Eve (Urdnot Bakara)
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P3.Eve].

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: After Wrex leaves the Med Lab, you can talk to Eve about her past and the process of becoming a shaman. She will also talk about Maelon's experiments and the deaths of the other females. She speaks fondly of Wrex and Mordin.

missions.name: Urdnot Grunt
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Grunt].

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Talk to the Officer across from the Rapid Transit cars. He will take you to Grunt, who was arrested. You have to press him for the whole story, which is that he broke out of the hospital, got drunk and took pictures at the Presidium, and lit a C-Sec car on fire, and got blasted with riot foam. They only caught him when he stopped to get some noodles.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You can contact Grunt on the vidcomm. Grunt says it's about time Shepard showed up; he didn't want to win this thing all by himself.

missions.name: Jacob Taylor
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Jacob].

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Jacob on the Citadel

set.context: Meeting Jacob outside the casino - "I'm still angry with you."

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: After completing [megametracker://mission?id=A3.ExCerberusScientists], you can find Jacob at Huerta Memorial Hospital. He reveals he has a child.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description:
Jacob is looking after two orphans for the day. He wants to play Shattered Eezo with you. Afterwards you get lunch. 

If you romanced him in Game 2, you can slap him when you meet him.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You can contact Jacob on the vidcomm. Jacob says his kill count is through the roof. He says you should meet at a bar in Rio when the war is over.

missions.name: Jack
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Jack]. 

Jack is available as a love interest if romanced in Game 2, but she will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: Speaking to Jack in Purgatory
Playing a game at the Arena with Jack
Speaking to Jack after getting a tattoo

missions.name: 1st Citadel Conversation
missions.description: Speak to Jack in Purgatory on the Citadel. She discusses her nole role as mentor. And she dances with you.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Play a game with Jack at the Armax Arsenal Arena (you must have played at least one game for this to be available). If you romanced her previously, she will suggest a hookup during the game. There is a kiss and the rest is implied off-screen.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel DLC
missions.description: Jack has rescued a varren puppy. If romanced, Jack will give you a tattoo.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Jack says her team is pretty far south of your position. They saved some resistance fighters. She says she won't let you down. If you romanced her, she tells you not to get killed, because when this over, she's getting laid.

missions.name: Kasumi Goto
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Kasumi].

set.context: When Kasumi enters the casino

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Find a suspicious device in the casino. Kasumi and henchman will show up, about to start a heist. If you stop her from leaving, you can catch up.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You can contact Kasumi on the vidcomm. Kasumi says the Crucible is ready, but she has no idea what it will do.

missions.name: Kelly Chambers
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P2.Chambers]. 

Kelly is available as a love interest if romanced in Game 2, but she will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: First Citadel Conversation with Kelly
"Take care of the refugees." or two conversations later (after Sur'Kesh)

conversationRewards.context: Checking in with Kelly after the coup

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Kelly says she has cut ties with Cerberus. She recounts her traumatic kidnapping at the hands of the Collectors. If you want to keep her alive, tell her to change her name and hide from Cerberus. If she was feeding your fish in Game 2, she gives them back to you (including the Prejek Paddlefish).

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: If you instructed Kelly to hide from Cerberus, you can check in and she has changed her name and appearance.

missions.name: 3rd Citadel Convo
missions.description: If she hasn't already, Kelly will apologize for spying on you in Game 2 for Cerberus.

missions.name: 4th Citadel Convo
missions.description: Kelly will thank you for helping her to evade Cerberus during the coup (or she will not be there).

missions.name: 5th Citadel Convo
missions.description: Kelly will ask you if you have any romantic entanglements. You can say you still love her.

missions.name: 6th Citadel Convo
missions.description: Kelly will ask you if you have any romantic entanglements. You can say you still love her. There is an implied off-screen hookup. And she'll give you a picture of her.

missions.name: Legion
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Legion].

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Speak to Legion in the War Room. It thanks you for preventing Xen from seizing its platform. You can ask it about its interface with the Reapers, and about the repercussions of Game 2's heretic geth decision. It tells you that the quarians attack on the geth impelled them to align with the Reapers.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: Speak to Legion in the War Room. It says that the liberated geth are grateful for Shepard's actions.

missions.name: Miranda Lawson
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Miranda].

Miranda is available as a love interest if romanced in Game 2, but she will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: Speaking to Miranda at the Selkish Arms apartments
After dinner with Miranda in your apartment

options.trigger: Convince Miranda you aren't a clone (kiss her).

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Find Miranda at the Normandy Dock. She is worried about her sister Oriana, who has disappeared.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: You can speak to Miranda at the Spectre terminal. She has learned her father is working with the Illusive Man. If you want to keep her alive, warn her about Kai Leng.

missions.name: 3rd Citadel Convo
missions.description:
Miranda asks to speak with you at the Selkish Arms. She needs Alliance funding for a project, but cannot reveal the details. Give her the funding or this is your last conversation. She also confesses that she tried to implant a control chip in Shepard during the Lazarus project, but the Illusive Man stopped her.

If you previously romanced Miranda, there will also be an option for an off-screen hookup at the end of this conversation.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: You can invite Miranda up for a drink.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel DLC
missions.description: Meet Miranda near the quasar machines to play some roulette and ply her with wine.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You can contact Miranda on the vidcomm. Miranda says the Alliance has been a little reluctant to accept her help, but they were desperate. She tried to say goodbye, but you stop her and insist that you are all gonna make it through this.

missions.name: Mordin Solus
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Mordin].

set.context: Defending Mordin from Wrex's suspicions

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Mordin/Wiks is treating Eve, but Wrex storms in suspiciously. He is sent off to get a tissue sample, and after you speak with Eve, you can talk more to Mordin about the Genophage cure he is creating. He still refuses to admit the Genophage was wrong. He muses about what he'll do when the war is over, go to the beach and collect seashells, experiment on the seashells.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description:
_Note: this is available one mission after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.SurKesh]_ 

You can now ask Mordin about the Shroud.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: There are some messages from Mordin left in your apartment after the party.

missions.name: Admiral Shala'Raan
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P2.Raan].

conversationRewards.context: Warn Raan of the distress call from the Kanesh

missions.name: 1st Normandy Convo
missions.description: Talk to Raan in the War Room to learn more about the quarian fleet. You will learn that they have militarized their civilian fleet.

missions.name: 2nd Normandy Convo
missions.description: There is a garbled distress call in the War Room. Clean it up and warn Admiral Raan.

events.id: Completed: Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons or Rannoch: Admiral Koris

missions.name: Samara
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Samara]. 

Samara is available as a love interest if romanced in Game 2, but she will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: Speaking to Samara on the Citadel
Speaking to Samara at your apartment

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: After completing [megametracker://mission?id=A3.ArdatYakshiMonastery], if she survived, you can find Samara at the Citadel Embassies.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: You can chat with Samara about her wild adventures in the news. If you romanced her in Game 2, you can share a romantic kiss and embrace.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Samara says its past time she joined the battle. She says you will only be remembered for your actions.

missions.name: Thane Krios
missions.description:
Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Thane]. 

Thane is available as a love interest if romanced in Game 2, but he will not show up for the pre-Earth Normandy romantic encounter.

set.context: First conversation with Thane at the hospital
Speaking to the doctor, after Thane is wounded in the coup

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Kolyat

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description:
Talk to Thane about his declining health. He will reject any attempt to recruit him to the Normandy. If you romanced him in Game 2 and Ashley/Kaidan in Game 1, he will inquire about the state of that relationship. If you ask for some private time, there is some making out. 

If you don't speak to Thane before [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2], he will die before the coup.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: Speak to the doctor about Thane's condition, then speak to Kolyat and say goodbye to Thane.

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Invite the crew to a memorial for Thane. Kolyat will leave you with some messages from Thane. They are romantic messages, if you have romanced Thane.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel DLC
missions.description: If Thane is still your only love interest, he will appear to you as a ghost before you reboard the Normandy after the party ([YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=00ymaEG0Nac]).

missions.name: Councilor Udina
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P1.Udina].

set.context: "Speaking to Udina in his office after Ashley/Kaidan is promoted to Spectre"

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Udina is furious at the Council for not supporting Earth. He plans to acquire funding and materials to help as best he can. He plans to lean heavily on the colonies for funding. He gives you tips on the individual councilors and how they think.

missions.name: 2nd Citadel Convo
missions.description: After Ashley/Kaidan is out of bed, go speak to Udina in his office.

missions.name: Primarch Victus
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=P3.VictusA].

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Victus says he is sorry to see Earth in the same ruin as Palaven.

missions.name: Urdnot Wrex
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S1.Wrex].

set.context: If the Genophage cure was sabotaged and Wrex survived Game 1, he will attack Shepard at the Normandy dock during the third visit

options.trigger: Shoot Wrex, sending him off the balcony to his death.

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: If you betrayed Wrex (not Wreave) by releasing a fake Genophage cure, he will try to kill you at the Normandy dock.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: Wrex says you've united the galaxy. If Bakara/Eve survived, he says she is pregnant and sends her regards. She wants to name her first child "Mordin."

missions.name: Zaeed Massani
missions.description: Conversations with [megametracker://person?id=S2.Zaeed].

events.id: Completed: Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons and Rannoch: Admiral Koris or Priority: Rannoch

missions.name: 1st Citadel Convo
missions.description: Talk to Zaeed in the loading docks and gain an asset for the war.

events.id: Completed: Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons and Rannoch: Admiral Koris or Priority: Rannoch

missions.name: 1st Citadel DLC
missions.description: Zaeed has been thwarted by the Claw game. Help him out and then catch up.

missions.name: Forward Operations Base
missions.description: You can contact Zaeed on the vidcomm. Zaeed says he's glad to see you made it and he's ready to go when you are.

missions.name: Normandy Arguments
missions.description: Arguments between two parties on the Normandy. You choose which person to support.

missions.name: Allers vs Copeland
missions.description: Allers is arguing with Yeoman Copeland over her opinion that Terra Nova should be sacrificed to save other colonies. Pick a side.

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Allers and Copeland

missions.name: Adams vs. Donnelly
missions.description: Donnelly and Adams are arguing about whether EDI is the Normandy or simply controls the Normandy. Pick a side.

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Adams and Donnelly

missions.name: Liara vs. Joker
missions.description: In Liara's office, Joker wants to know if asari tentacles move, and Liara is pissed off at the question. Pick a side.

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Liara and Joker

missions.name: Chakwas/Michel vs Adams
missions.description:
_Note: this is available one assignment after [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.GethDreadnought]_ 

Dr. At the conference table by the kitchen, Chakwas/Michel is arguing with Engineer Adams about whether artificial intelligence is really life. Pick a side.

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Chakwas/Michel and Adams

missions.name: Admirals Raan vs Gerrel
missions.description: In the War Room, Raan wants to withdraw the patrol fleet while there's time, Gerrel wants them to stay to shield the heavy fleet while they are repaired. Pick a side.

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Raan and Gerrel

events.id: Completed: Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons or Rannoch: Admiral Koris

missions.name: Admiral Xen vs Tali
missions.description: In the War Room, Tali demands that Xen allow ships to rescue life pods. Xen wants to use them to recover geth technology from the downed geth ships. Pick a side.

set.context: Resolving the argument between Xen and Tali

missions.name: Javik vs EDI
missions.description: In the AI Core, Javik thinks synthetic life can not evolve and is a threat to organic life. EDI says she can update her code and the only threat she presents is to organics who try to harm her first. Pick a side.

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Javik and EDI

missions.name: Daniels vs Donnelly
missions.description:
Daniels demands to know why Donnelly is always making sexist remarks about everyone but her. Pick a side. 

_Note: After this conversation, check on them in the subdeck after completing Priority: Thessia, to interrupt them hooking up... err, double-checking the Thermal Ducts._

conversationRewards.context: Resolving the argument between Daniels and Donnelly

missions.name: Citadel Arguments
missions.description: Arguments between two parties on the Citadel. You choose which person to support.

missions.name: Officer vs. Refugee
missions.description: A Dock Officer has informed a refugee that his ship must leave because there is not enough room. The refugee is upset and tries to bribe her. Pick a side.

missions.name: Receptionist vs Visitor
missions.description: At the reception desk, a visitor is arguing that naming the hospital after President Huerta - who died of a stroke and was revived with a VI - is in poor taste. In the receptionist's opinion, he is as good as dead. Pick a side.

missions.name: Arguing Physicians
missions.description: A human physician is arguing with her salarian colleague that the hospital needs to start triaging patient needs for when supply shortages arise, allowing the most terminal to die. Pick a side.

missions.name: Reluctant vs Gung-ho Citizen
missions.description: Two citizens are arguing about how to help the war effort near the Bank in the Presidium Commons. The gung-ho citizen wants to enlist, but the reluctant citizen thinks they do not have the requisite skills. Pick a side.

missions.name: Businessmen
missions.description: Two businessmen are arguing about whether to switch from financial VIs to military tech to help in the war effort. Warn them to help however they can.

missions.name: Arguing Couple
missions.description: [megametracker://person?id=O1.PetrovskyM] and [Rebekah|megametracker://person?id=O1.PetrovskyR] are still arguing about her son. Pick a side.

missions.name: Sales Clerk vs Customer
missions.description: A customer wants a cash refund. The clerk insists he can't help without a sales record of some kind. Pick a side.

missions.name: Bank Teller vs Customer
missions.description: A salarian customer is threatening to withdraw their money because it isn't safe. The volus teller explains that the money is being used to support Citadel security, so removing it makes him less safe. Pick a side.

missions.name: Officer vs Officer
missions.description: An angry asari C-Sec officer in the C-Sec office is complaining that C-Sec is policing petty crimes when it should be going after terrorists. The human officer argues that it is still important to address minor crimes. Pick a side.

missions.name: Merchants
missions.description: A worried merchant is trying to persuade an angry merchant to stop selling so many weapons to everyone on the Citadel. Pick a side.

missions.name: Officer vs Cafe Owner
missions.description: A C-Sec officer is trying to pressure a cafe owner to hand over his security vids. Pick a side.
